div.p: ARTICLES to be enquired of, by the Church-wardens and Swornemen, within the Archdeaconrie of Worcester,
In the visitation of the right wowshipful WILLIAM SVVADDON, Doctor of Diuinitie, Archdeacon of Worcester. ANNO DOM. 1615.
¶ Imprinted at London, 1615.

div.head: ❧ The tenour of the Oath to be ministred to all and euery of the Churchwardens and Sidemen or Assistants in the said Visitation.
div.p: YOu, and euery of you shall sweare by Almightie GOD, that all fauour, feare, and affection, and all other sinister corruption whatsoeuer, set aside, vpon due consideration of these Articles giuen you in charge, you will make a true, plaine, perfect, and particular answere and presentment in writing to the same Articles, and to euery branch and part thereof, presenting all and euery offendours and offences therein mentioned, so as may stand with the glory of God, the discharge of your Consciences, and the iurisdiction of the Ecclesiasticall Court: wherein you shall deale sincerely, faithfully, and vprightly as before GOD; So helpe you GOD in CHRIST IESVS.

div.head: ¶ A Note of Directions.
div.p: 1 THe old Church-wardens and Sidemen of euery Parish Church, and Chappell, are to ioyne together in appearance and presentment vpon the Articles deliuered them at the last Visitation; and the Minister also may ioyne in presentment with them, if they will: or otherwise the Minister may present alone. And the new elected Churchwardens and Sidemen are to appeare, and to take their oathes, and to exhibite their presentments afterwards when they shalbe assigned, as by the 118. and 119. Canon is required. The presentments to be made, are to be plainly and particularly set downe to answere euery part and branch of euery seueral Article following, and to bee subscribed and testified vnder the Haudes and Markes of all and singular the presentors.

2 The Proprietaries, Parsons, Vicars, Curates, and Sequestrators of Ecclesiasticall Benefices, and their respectiue Farmers, and all Schoolemasters, Vshers, and Vnder-schoolemasters, &c. of, or within euery Parish, Church, and Chappell, are also to appeare, and to exhibite their Letters of orders, Institutions, and Inductions, and all other their Dispensations, Licences, or Faculties whatsoeuer; not beeing formerly exhibited in any Visitation of the moderne Archdeacon aforesayd, now visiting. And they are also to make reall payment of all such Procurations and Synodals, and other Duties as are respectiuely due and payable by euery of them seuerally in this Visitation.

div.head: ARTICLES, Concerning Church and Churchyard.
div.p: 1 WHether is your Church, and Chancell in all respects well and sufficiently repayred, and kept sweet and cleane: Haue you therein the ten Commandements, the Articles of the beliefe, and other Godly sentences, fairely written: The English Bible in the largest Volume, of the last and New Edition, authorized by His Maiesties speciall Commandement, and approued to be read in Churches: The Bookes of Common prayer, the two volumes of Homilies, and all other Bookes requisite, a seemely Pulpit, a conuenient Seate for the Minister at Prayers, a large and comely Surplesse whole and vntorne:
2 Haue you in your said Church a strong Chest for Almes, with a hole in the top, and three lockes and keyes thereto: Is the money therein put, imployed to the vse of the Poore:
3 Haue you a Register of Christinings, Weddings, and Burials, in a Booke of Parchment duely kept in a Chest with three Lockes and Reyes:
4 Hath any man pulled downe or vncouered any Church, Chauncell, Chappell, Vestery, or Church-house, in part, or in all:

5 Are your Bels, Belropes, and Clocke, in good repayre, and well ordered: Is your Churchyard wellfenced and decently kept: Is it not prophaned with fighting, brawling, chiding, gaming, dancing, playing, or with unlawfull Cattell, or otherwise; and how, and by whome, and in whose default:

div.head: Ministers and Curates.
div.p: 6 Is your Minister a licented Preacher, doeth he diligently preach sound Doctrine, reuerently administer the holy Sacraments, and for matters of gouernement, seriously teach and maintaine the Kings Supremacie vnder God within His Maiesties Dominions, ouer all persons, and in causes as well Ecclesiasticall as Ciuill, and the aholishing of all forraine Power:

7 Hath your Minister more Benefices then one; if two, or more,
doth he reside vpon one of them himselfe, and maintaine a licensed Preacher on the other: If he hath but one, is hee resident, and dwelling therevpon, is hee painefull in his vocation, of sober and good conuersation, and giuen to hospitalitie:

8 Doth your Minister vse decencie of Apparel, a wel in the Church as else where: And in time of diuine prayer and administration of the Sacraments, doeth he vse to weare the Surplesse; and if he be a Graduate, such a Hood as is agreeable to his calling:

9 Is your Minister a peacemaker, and no sower of discord, or is he suspected, famed, or noted of any notorious crime; or giueth hee any ill example: or do any Ministers with you forsake their callings:
10 Doth any preach in your Parish, that refuseth to conforme himself to the lawes, ordinances, and rites of the Church of England:
11 Hath your Minister a Curate, and how is hee licensed; doth hee serue two Cures, and doth hee bid the Fasting dayes, and Holy dayes, commanded and allowed:
12 If your Minister be not a Preacher allowed, doth hee procure monthly Sermones; and when there is no Sermon, doth he read an Homily; doth he take vpon him to expound any text of Scripture:

13 What Preachers haue come from any other place and preached in your Parish; haue you their names written in a booke kept for that purpose; hath such Preacher subscribed his name thereto, and set downe the day when he preached, and by whom Licensed;
14 Hath your Minister obtained his Benefice by any Sinooncall compace eyther directly or indirectly:
15 Hath any of your Parish, or of any other Parish, vnteuerently vsed your Minister, layed violent hands on him, or disgraced his office, and function, by word or deed:

div.head: Diuine Seruice.
div.p: 16 Is diuine Seruice in due time on Sundayes, Holydayes, and at other times appoynted, reuerently sayd or sung in your Church or Chappell, with the Letany, on Wednesdayes, and Frydayes; and all other rites and ceremonies, according to the prescript forme of Common prayer in the Communion Booke:
17 Whetherdoth any not being licensed (or any not orvered at least for a Deacon) say Common prayer openly in your Church or Chappel:

18 Doe any Men (young or old) vse to were their Hattes in the Church or Chappell, in time of diuine Seruice; or are there any that
behaue themselues disorderly in the Church, Ceappell, or Churchyard, or any disturbers of diuine Seruice or Sermons?
19 Whether doe any Victualers (or others in your Parish) suffer any drinking, or gaming in their houses on Sundayes or Holydayes, especially in time of diuine Seruice, or Sermons?

20 Whether any in your Parish vpon the Saboth dayes, or Holydayes, doe vse their Trade, or doe any other worke or labour, as Brewing, Baking, Washing, or such like, or doe open their Shoppes for sale of wares vpon those dayes, or doe hedge, ditch, carry, or drawe burdens by themselues, their Seruants, Horses, or other Cattell whatsoeuer on such dayes?

div.head: The holy Communion.
div.p: 21 Haue you a decent Communion Table on a frame, with a seemly Carpet, and a cloth of Linnen, a Communion cuppe and couer of Siluer, a faire Flaggon of Pewter or purer mettall for the wine, a Plate for the Bread, and a Towell to lay ouer it?

22 Whether is there any in your Parish, which being full sixteene yeeres of age and vpwards, hath not receiued the holy Communion three seuerall times in the yeere past at the least, in his or her Parish Church, whereof Easter to be one of the three times?

23 Doth your Minister instruct and examine his Parishoners couceruing the Sacraments at conuenient times, before hee administer the Communion: And doth he admit any thereto that cannot say at least the Lords Prayer, the Articles of the Christian fayth, and the tenne Commandements?

24 Is your Communion ministred with Bread and Wine, consecrated in such order as in the booke of Common prayer is appoynted? And doth your Minister deliuer both kindes to euery seuerall Communicant, with the blessing prescribed in the booke of Common prayer?

25 Doth any in your Parish receiue the holy Communion eyther sitting, standing, or otherwise then kneeling, as is prescribed in the Booke of Common prayer; or doe any refuse to receiue the same kneeling; and doth your Minister admitte any to receiue the Communion otherwise then kneeling?

26 Doth your Minister admitte any notorious offendoures, or any Schismatickes to the holy Communion before due penance enioyned by the Ordinarie, be ducly performed by them: or doth hee admitte any
notorously knowen to be out of charitie; or any that hath done any open wrong to his Neighbour before reconciliation made to the partie wronged?

27 Whether doth your Minister appoynt and obserue so many Communions in one yeere, as that the parishioners may conueniently receiue all of them there three seuerall times in the yeere: And doth hee vse to giue publique notice thereof in the Church, the Sabboth day next going before euery such Communions, that the Parishioners may prepare themselues to be pertakers thereof?

div.head: Baptisme.
div.p: 28 Haue you in your Church a conuenient Font of Stone, well kept, and couered, standing in the auncient place; doth your Minister Baptise therein, or in any Bason, or other thing, or with any other ceremonies then such as are allowed in the Booke of common prayer; or doth he omit, neglect, or not vse all the ceremonies therein prescribed; and doth he vse the signe of the crosse in Baptisme?
29 Doth your Minister refuse to Baptise any Children of christian parentes, that are brought to the Church?

30 Are Parents vrged to be present at the Baptising of their Children; or be any admitted to be God-fathers or God-mothers that haue not receiued the holy Communion; or doe any parents refuse to haue their Children signed with the signe of the Crosse in their baptisme?
31 Haue any children that were borne in your parish been carried out of the parish to be Baptised else where; or haue any not been baptised at all, or in places and by parties vnknowne?

32 Whether hath your Minister refused, deferred, or delayed to come vnto, and to christen any Child being in weaknesse or in danger of death, being thereunto required, by reason whereof such Childe hath (through his negligence, or by his fault) dyed vnbaptized?

div.head: Catechisme.
div.p: 33 Doth your Minister, or his Curate, duely Catechise according to the late Canon euery Sunday, such children and seruantes of both sexes, as are of conuenient age, or at least so many of them by course, as the time will serue?
34 Doe Parentes and Householders bring or send their Children and Seruants, to the Church euery Sunday duely to be catechises, accordingly as the late Canons require, and who are negligent therein:

div.head: Matrimonie.
div.p: 35 Whether is Matrimonie solemnized in your Church or Chappell, according to the Booke of Common prayer?

36 Haue you in your Church a Table of Degrees of Mariage; are any maried within the degrees of Consanguinity or Affinity therein forbidden; or do any Children vnder the age of twenty one yeares, contract themselues, or marry without consent of their Parents or Gardians?

37 Haue any bin Married without Banes thrise asked in the Church three seuerall Sundayes or Holy-dayes (vnlesse by License of the Ordinary graunted vnder Seale) or at any time of the day, then betwixt the houres of eight and twelue in the forenoone; or at any times prohibited, that is to say, from Aduent sunday, to the Octaues of the Epiphany from Septuagesima Sunday, to the Octaues of Easter: from Rogation sunday, to Trinitie sunday?

38 Haue any that dwell in your Parish, been married in any other Parish, or any of an other Parish been maried in your Parish; or haue any been married priuatly out of the Church or face of the Congregation, when, where, by whom, and who were present at such Mariages?

39 Hath any Woman not well knowen to be married, beene deliuered of any Child in your Parish, and in whose house: or hath any Woman in pour Parish beene carnally knowen, or begotten with Child before Marriage, and by whom?
40 Haue any forsaken their Wiues or Husbandes, and maried others; haue any maried againe after they haue beene Diuorced: Or doe any which haue beene Diuorced, keepe company still together?
41 Doe any Maried couples liue a sunder and not togeather, and doe either of them keepe in their house, or secretly resort to any other, to the raysing of suspition or fame of incontinencie?

42 Hath any in your Parish for mony or reward, Married any Woman that committed Fornication or Adultery with an other man? Or hath any vnmaried Woman begotten with child, goue out of your Parish before she hath done Pennaunce enioyned her by the Ordinarie; where was she, or is she receiued or harboured, at whose charge, and who conueyed her away;

div.head: Visitation of the sicke.
div.p: 43 Doth your Minister or Curate visit the Sicke, doth he admonish them to repentance, comfort the Penitent, and exhort them to Charitable and almes deedes?

div.head: Buriall of the Dead.
div.p: 44 Are your Dead buried according to the forme of Buriall set downe in the booke of Common prayer; or haue any been buried secretly or in the night, who, and by whom, and who were present thereat?
45 Doe the Executors or Administrators, or other friends of them that are buried in Church or Chancell, repayre againe the Pauements, and giue any thing to the Church?

div.head: Churching of Women.
div.p: 46 Doe any Women refuse to giue God thankes openly in the Church, or (as wee terme it) to be Churched at conuenient times after Childbirth; or doth any Minister refuse to Church them, or Church them any other wise then is prescribed in the Booke of Common prayer?

47 Hath any Woman vnlawfully begotten with Child, been admitted to publique Thanks-giuing in the Church, before she hath performed such Penaunce as was enioyned her by the Ordinary, or at least beene Churched in a White sheete, and confessed her fault penitently before sufficient witnesses, and vndertaken to stand to the censurt of her Ordinary for her sayd offence?

div.head: Parish Clarkes.
div.p: 48 Haue you a Parish Clarke chosen by the Minister, is he of honest conuersation, hath hee competent skill in reading, writing, and singing: And doth any withhold or detaine his Wages or duties from him?

div.head: Schoole-Masters.
div.p: 49 Haue you any Schoole-house, and how is it repayred: And haue you any Schoole-maister in your Parish that teacheth publiquely or priuatly, is he lawfully licensed; doth hee come duely to the Church and receiue the holy Communion: Doth hee instruct his Schollers in the Catechisme allowed, causeth he them to repaire to diuine Prayers in the Church, and to heare and note Sermons: Teacheth he any other Grammer then that which is allowed?

50 Is any Schoole-maister knowen or suspected publiquely or priuatly to read to their Scollers, or suffer them to read any Booke that may confirme them in popery, superstition, or disobedience to the Kings
Maiestie, or to his lawes ecclesiasticall or ciuill?

div.head: Schismatickes and Recusants of all sorts.
div.p: 51 Doe you know any that teach or maintaine any doctrine contrary to the Articles agreed vpon in the Conuocation. Anno Dom. 1562.
52 Doth any Preach, minister the Communion, baptise Children, or church Women, in priuate Houses, or other where then in the Church, except it be in cases of necessitie?

53 Know you any that absent themselues from the Church negligently or wilfully, how long haue they so done: And of them that are absent without a sufficient and lawful cause, is the forfayture of xii. d. taken euery Sunday, and conuerted to the vse of the poore, according to the Statute. Eliza. 1?
54 In your Parish where there is a Preacher, doe any vse to absent themselues from his Sermon, and resort to any other?
55 Know you any that forbeare to participate with the Church of England in Prayer or Sacraments, either denying the Church to be Apostolicall, or condemning the Ceremonies thereof as superstitious?

56 Haue you in your Parish any popish Recusants, any halfe Papistes that come t • the Church and receiue not the Communion, any Church Papists that come and receiue themselues, but either perswade others, or maintaine their wiues, children, familie, or friends not to come?
57 Doeth any Seminary Priest or Iesuite resort to any place within this Dioces, or suspect you any such: Or doe you know any that resort to any Popish Priest or Iesuite?

58 Know you any that by writing, talke, or argument, impugne the Kings Supremacie, or any that haue kept in their custody, that sell, disperse, carie, or deliuer vnto others, any vnlawfull bookes against the Religion and Gouernement established, or in defence of any forreigne power or domesticall consistory?

div.head: Excommunicated persons.
div.p: 59 Are all Excommunicate persons kept out of the Church from Diuine prayers, and receiuing of the holy Communion vntill they bee lawfully absolued? And are there any in your Parish which haue stood excommunicate fourtie dayes and vpward; are such persons as stand excommunicated, once in eurey sixe moneths denounced in your Church in time of Diuine Seruice vpon some Sunday?

60 Hath any Excommunicated person not absolued, (at least in his extreamitie) nor giuing any testimony of his repentance before his departure, beene buried in christian burials, who buried him, her, or them; where, and when, and who were present at such burials?

61 Doe any retaine or ke • pe in their house or seruice any person denounced excommunicate, or doe any way encourage them therein, or conuerse with them in buying, felling, eating, drinking, or otherwise?

div.head: Willes, Testaments, and Administrations.
div.p: 62 Doe any in your parish administer the Goods of the dead, or any way entermeddle therewith, without lawfull authoritie committed vnto them vnder the Ordinaries Seale?

63 Knowe you any in your parish that suppresse the last Will of the Dead; or any that forge or altar any Willes; or any Executors that fulfill not the Testators will; or any that detaine Legacies giuen to any charitable vses?

div.head: Seuerall Articles.
div.p: 64 Doe any in your parish prophane the Sabath dayes, or not duely obserue the Holy dayes appointed: Are the Ember-fastes orderly obserued at the foure times of the yeere appointed?
65 Are the dayes and orders of Perambulation duely obserued in the Rogation weeke: if not in whose default?

66 Are the Canons, Constitutions, and Orders, made and agreed vpon in the Conuocation house Anno Dom. 1603. reade ouer once euery yeere in your Church vpon Sundayes or Holy-dayes, according to his Maiesties commandement in that behalfe?

67 Doth your Minister yeerely present, and giue vp in writing to the Ordinarie the names of all Recusants, and halfe Recusants, men and women, as well soiourners as parishioners, and common guestes in your parish aboue the age of thirteene yeeres, according to the 114. Canon, or not?
68 Doe any in your parish take vpon them to practise Phisicke or Chirurgerie, not being lawfully licensed?

69 Are any in your parish (or which were of your parish & are now departed) knowen, suspected, famed, or reported, to haue offended in Fornication, Adultery, Incest, Witchcraft, Sorcerie, Charming, Vsurie, Swearing, Drunkennesse, common Slandering, Sowing of discord, Brawling, Scoulding, or any other vncleannesse of life, or bad
manners?
70 Haue any Apparators, or others, taken any reward to compound or conceale any offence presentable or punishable in the Ecclesiasticall Court?

div.head: Churchwardens and Sidemen.
div.p: 71 Are your Churchwardens and Sidemen chosen yeerely in the Easter weeke according to the Canons: And doe the Churchwardens yeerely, truely make and deliuer vp in writing their account of all their receipts and disbursements whatsoeuer, by them receiued and layde out for the Parish: and of all the Church goods, Bookes, and other things, as the Canons require?

72 Doe your Churchwardens themselues come duely to the Church to diuine Prayers and Sermons; and doe they their beast endeauours, especially on Sundayes and Holydayes, to cause all Parishoners to doe the like?
73 Whether is there a transcript or coppie of the Register booke of the Church of Christnings, Weddings, and Burials, yeerely exhibited and deliuered vp into the Regestrie of the Ordinarie, or not?

74 Haue the late Churchwardens concealed any crime, Offence, or Disorder in their times, and not presented the same: what be the matters so concealed: Or Doeth any trouble, molest, or vexe the Minister, Churchwardens or Sidemen, for being presented by them; and who be they that so doe?

75 Haue you aduisedly and diligently perused, read, or heard others reade and peruse this Booke of Articles, and euery particuler Article and branch thereof; and haue you framed your Answeres and Presentments to the same accordingly?

76 Generally, whether doe you know any of the Canons (lately set foorth and approoued by his Maiestie) broken, or any other Ecclesiasticall matter worthy to bee presented, or not; and if you doe, you shall truely present the same by the Oath you haue taken?
